hero.title: Alarm buttons and safety solutions
hero.subtitle: When every second counts, you want to be sure that help is just one button press away.

whenEverySecond.title: When every second counts
whenEverySecond.text1: You may have thought about it more than once. What if dad suddenly gets chest pain, or mom faints in the kitchen? How quickly can they alert someone, and what if no one is there to hear?
whenEverySecond.text2: It's a painful thought to carry. Our alarm buttons and safety solutions ensure that mom or dad can reach you or healthcare personnel with one simple press, whether they're at home or out.

howAlarmButtonsWork.title: How do alarm buttons work?
howAlarmButtonsWork.text1: They are usually worn around the neck or in the pocket. If something happens, they just press the button and are immediately connected to a pre-selected contact, for example you, another relative or healthcare personnel.
howAlarmButtonsWork.text2: The alarm system can be set up so that it first tries to reach you, then other relatives, and finally healthcare personnel if no one answers.
howAlarmButtonsWork.text3: With two-way communication, they can speak directly with help without having to find the phone.

whereDoesThisFit.title: Where does this fit best?
whereDoesThisFit.outdoor: Outdoors, for elderly who still like to walk or shop themselves. With GPS and mobile network, you can see where they are and get notified if something happens.
whereDoesThisFit.home: At home, as a safety measure in the kitchen, living room or bathroom. One press, and help is on the way.
whereDoesThisFit.dementia: For people with dementia or memory problems, where a safety button provides extra security, both for them and you.

whatAboutFalls.title: What about falls or if they can't press?
whatAboutFalls.text1: An alarm button is fantastic when they can press it themselves. But if they fall and can't reach it, it can be smart to combine it with an automatic fall sensor. Then you also get an alert if they are weak, confused or lose consciousness.
whatAboutFalls.text2: Many choose exactly this combination to be completely safe.

whyChooseOurAlarms.title: Why choose our alarms?
points: Works both indoors and outdoors, wherever there is mobile coverage.
Gives you an alert immediately, not hours later.
Tailored to their needs: alerts can go to you, other relatives, or directly to healthcare personnel.
Secure two-way communication, they get help without having to look for the phone.
No commitment or startup cost, and can be expanded with fall sensors or medical monitoring later.

steps.title: Rental or purchase of equipment
steps.text: The customer gets access to the equipment either through rental or purchase.

steps.title: Choice of recipient
steps.text: The customer decides whether the alarms should go directly to a monitoring station (with external cost) or to their own contacts (for example, relatives or neighbors).

steps.title: When the alarm is triggered
steps.text: If there is an agreement with a monitoring station, the alarm goes there and is handled by them. If the alarm goes to relatives, it will first alert the main contact.

steps.title: The fallback principle
steps.text: If the main contact does not answer, the alarm goes to the next contact (fallback 1). If that contact also does not answer, it goes to fallback 2, and so on. The last fallback can be the monitoring station, if an agreement exists.

steps.title: Action
steps.text: When either the monitoring station or a relative receives and answers the alarm, they will initiate necessary actions. This could be contacting healthcare personnel, going out themselves, or taking other necessary action.

typicalPrice.title: Typical price
typicalPrice.text: Alarm button with GPS and two-way talk costs from around 299 kroner per month, depending on the setup you desire. No binding or hidden costs, and you can always expand with more sensors or medical monitoring later.
typicalPrice.disclaimer: When ordering, there is a deposit of 800 for the sensor, which will be deducted from the monthly rent.

flexibility.title: Flexibility:

simplerLife.title: Simpler everyday life:
simplerLife.text: We take care of setup, maintenance and return when the need is no longer there.

financialSecurity.title: Financial security:
financialSecurity.text: You avoid tying up large sums in equipment that might otherwise sit unused.

whyRentInstead.conclusion: Many competitors only offer purchase, but NordicMedTek believes renting is the most sensible and gentle solution for private individuals. When needs change, the rental can be easily terminated and products returned - you pay only for what you need and get access to modern, reliable solutions without unnecessary risk.

hero.subtitle1: Prevent a fall from changing everything.
hero.subtitle2: Our sensors detect falls completely automatically.
hero.secondaryTitle: Security for you and good health follow-up for them
hero.description1: You may worry about your elderly parents becoming frail, especially if they already have health conditions like heart problems, breathing difficulties, or diabetes. This increases your concern.
hero.question1: How do you know everything is okay between doctor's visits?
hero.question2: What if the values suddenly worsen, and no one discovers it in time?
hero.description2: Our solutions for medical follow-up give you and your family a whole new sense of security. They automatically monitor important health values, right from the living room at home, and share the data with you, or directly with healthcare personnel if you wish.

whenEverySecond.title: When health monitoring matters
whenEverySecond.text1: You may have thought about it more than once. What if dad's blood pressure spikes, or mom's blood sugar drops dangerously low? How quickly can you detect these changes, and what if no one is there to monitor?
whenEverySecond.text2: It's a concern that weighs on many families. Our medical monitoring solutions ensure continuous tracking of vital signs, with automatic alerts when intervention is needed.

howMedicalMonitoring.title: How does medical follow-up work at home?
howMedicalMonitoring.text1: Sensors can be placed under the mattress, on the chair where they sit most, or connected to the body with simple measuring instruments. These measure completely contactlessly or with small units that are used for just a few seconds at a time.
howMedicalMonitoring.subtitle: Typically they can measure:
howMedicalMonitoring.measurement4: Sleep and deviations that may indicate something is wrong
howMedicalMonitoring.text2: All this automatically goes into our system, which you and the doctor can follow via a simple portal. If something abnormal happens, it can be alerted directly.
howMedicalMonitoring.imageAlt1: Sensors and placements for medical monitoring
howMedicalMonitoring.imageAlt2: System overview of medical monitoring devices

combinedWithEasyContact.title: Combined with easy contact with the doctor and family
combinedWithEasyContact.text1: For many elderly, it is safe to know that both health and contact with the outside world are taken care of simultaneously. With easeBlink get a dedicated screen at home that allows mom or dad to
combinedWithEasyContact.feature1: have video consultations with the general practitioner, such as collecting measurements of pulse, breath, and blood pressure,
combinedWithEasyContact.feature2: measurements of pulse, breath, and blood pressure,
combinedWithEasyContact.feature3: receive messages and pictures from the family,
combinedWithEasyContact.feature4: and have one button to press to talk to you or healthcare personnel.
combinedWithEasyContact.text2: This provides both medical safety and social contact in the same solution.
combinedWithEasyContact.imageAlt: Combined medical monitoring and family communication system

hero.title: Fall sensors and safety at home
hero.subtitle: Prevent a fall from changing everything. Our sensors detect falls completely automatically.
hero.secondaryTitle: Prevent a fall from changing everything
hero.description1: A small fall can have major consequences. A hip fracture or hours alone on the floor can mean that mom or dad never fully recovers. Perhaps you have already noticed that balance fails a little more often, or that they seem more unsteady on the stairs or in the bathroom.
hero.description2: Many elderly people also become afraid after a fall. They withdraw and dare less, and quality of life declines along with safety. As a relative, you carry a worry, what if it happens when no one is there?
hero.description3: Our fall sensors cannot prevent all falls, but they ensure that a fall is never left undetected.

whenEverySecond.title: When falls happen unexpectedly
whenEverySecond.text1: You may have worried about it more than once. What if mom falls in the bathroom, or dad trips on the stairs? How quickly can they get help, and what if no one is there to hear them?
whenEverySecond.text2: It's a concern that weighs on many families. Our discrete fall sensors automatically detect falls and send immediate alerts to you or healthcare personnel, ensuring help is always available.

howFallSensorsWork.title: How do fall sensors work?
howFallSensorsWork.text1: Our sensors use radar or infrared technology to detect falls automatically, and can be placed in the living room, bedroom, stairs or bathroom. They capture movement patterns and alert when something is not right, for example if someone falls and does not get up again.
howFallSensorsWork.subtitle: This means:
howFallSensorsWork.benefit1: Mom or dad doesn't need to remember to wear anything.
howFallSensorsWork.benefit2: You get a notification immediately, and can contact them or send help.
howFallSensorsWork.benefit3: The system can also notify healthcare personnel directly if you wish.
howFallSensorsWork.text2: When a fall is detected, the system immediately sends alerts to pre-selected contacts or healthcare personnel. The sensors can distinguish between normal activities and actual falls to reduce false alarms.

whereDoesThisFitBest.title: Where do fall sensors fit best?

useCase1.title: Bathroom Safety
useCase1.description: Bathroom safety: The most common placement for falls, our sensors provide immediate detection and alert when slips or falls occur in wet, slippery conditions.

useCase2.title: Bedroom Monitoring
useCase2.description: Bedroom monitoring: Detect falls that occur when getting in or out of bed, or during nighttime activities, and provides security for both residents and caregivers.

useCase3.title: Stair Safety
useCase3.description: Stair safety: Monitor stairs for falls and provide immediate alerts when someone stumbles or falls on steps, ensuring quick assistance when mobility is compromised.

whereDoesThisFitBest.generalBenefit: Many choose to have sensors in several rooms, to cover the entire home and avoid the worry of a fall happening in a "blind spot". All our sensors are discreet and are placed on the wall or ceiling. If you have mounted a picture, you can easily do this yourself.

whyChooseOurFallSensors.title: Why choose our fall sensors?
points: Automatic fall detection, regardless of whether the user remembers an alarm.
Immediate alerts to the user or healthcare personnel.
Connectivity to security alarms, video screens, or medical monitoring for a complete solution.
Secure data storage in Norway, adhering to strict privacy requirements.

familyContactSecurity.title: Also security in the form of contact with family
familyContactSecurity.description: This section includes how fall sensors enhance safety through family contact. It introduces "easeBlink," a screen with user-friendly buttons that allows elderly parents to receive photos and messages from family and easily make video calls, providing a sense of security even when living alone.
familyContactSecurity.imageAlt: Family contact interface showing photos and messages

whatDistinguishesFromAlarmButton.title: What distinguishes this from an alarm button?
whatDistinguishesFromAlarmButton.description: Alarm buttons rely on the user remembering to wear them and being able to press them. In contrast, fall sensors operate autonomously, alerting immediately if something happens, even if the user is weak, confused, or unable to press a button. This provides an extra layer of security beyond an alarm button.

steps.title: Fall detection
steps.text: Sensors continuously monitor for fall patterns and sudden impacts in designated areas of the home.

steps.title: Alert generation
steps.text: When a fall is detected, the system immediately generates alerts to pre-selected contacts or healthcare personnel.

steps.title: Contact notification
steps.text: Alerts are sent via multiple channels - phone calls, text messages, and app notifications to ensure someone is reached quickly.

steps.title: Response coordination
steps.text: The system can coordinate with healthcare providers or emergency services if immediate medical attention is needed.

steps.title: Follow-up monitoring
steps.text: After an alert, the system continues monitoring to ensure the person's safety and can provide additional assistance if needed.

financialSecurity.title: Cost predictability:

whyRentInstead.conclusion: Fall prevention is most effective when it can adapt to changing needs and home layouts. Renting allows you to access the latest sensor technology without the burden of ownership, ensuring your loved ones always have the most appropriate safety monitoring solution.

howGuardianWorks.title: Do you want to see how the Guardian series works in practice?
howGuardianWorks.button2: Start a pilot in home care services
howGuardianWorks.subtitle: These are the products that keep an eye on the user
howGuardianWorks.description: A complete solution for safety and fall protection at home usually consists of three parts:
howGuardianWorks.component1: Fall sensors mounted on the wall or ceiling that detect if someone falls and does not get up again.
howGuardianWorks.component2: A central unit that collects data from the sensors and sends it securely to the cloud, so that you and healthcare personnel can follow along.
howGuardianWorks.component3: Optional alarm button, which mother or father can press if they feel unwell or need help, before something happens.
howGuardianWorks.purpose: This is equipment made for completely ordinary homes, so that mother or father can continue to live safely at home, while you can feel safe that they will not be left alone after a fall.
howGuardianWorks.conclusion: How a complete solution is built

step1.title: Sensors that detect falls
step1.description: Small sensors are mounted on walls or ceilings in high-risk areas for falls, such as bathrooms, living rooms, or stairs. They use radar and infrared technology to monitor movement patterns and detect sudden changes, such as falls.
step1.products: GuardianSense and GuardianSense Pro for both wall and ceiling mounting, which cover larger areas and can also measure breath and pulse.

step2.title: Sensors that measure breath and pulse
step2.description: For extra safety, a sensor can be placed under a mattress or in a chair. It measures breath and pulse without the user noticing, and can alert if values suddenly change.
step2.products: VitalSense Pad and VitalTrack for this purpose.

step3.title: Central unit that connects everything
step3.description: For the sensors to be able to send data, a small box is needed at home. CoreHub or sensorCentral collects data from all sensors and sends it securely to the cloud.
step3.products: CoreHub or sensorCentral - necessary for the system to function.

step4.title: Can be combined with an alarm button
step4.description: Even with automatic fall detection, many choose to add an alarm button worn around the neck or in a pocket. This allows the user to press for help immediately if they feel something is wrong.
step4.products: Call button with 4G and GPS that works both at home and outside, or Local call button that connects directly to the home central.

questions.answer: No. Most of our products you can mount yourself, as easy as hanging a picture. We show you how.

questions.question: What does it cost?
questions.answer: Our solutions cost from approx. 299 kroner per month. It depends on how many sensors or services you choose.

questions.question: Do we need internet?
questions.answer: Yes, for the systems to send alerts and share data, there must be internet at home. If you don't have it already, we can help you with suggestions.

questions.answer: Yes. All data is stored on servers in Norway and follows strict requirements for data privacy (GDPR and DPIA).
